review: I've got 2 Roku's (one I gave to a friend) and bought a Chromecast at Xmas for myself. Before that...had an android TV stick I ordered from China. The problem with the Roku's and the Chromecast is you can't run XBMC/Kodi on them. On the Amazon Fire's...not only can I do this...but the remote works fantastically. The Chromecast is way too unstable to be usable for anything but sucking up electricity.Now...the only problem I've had on the Fire Stick is my wireless dropping out...making the device useless. It's not Amazon's fault...but it would've been nice to have an additional USB port where I could've plugged in an adapter and then plugged in a USB Ethernet connector. When I can't get the wireless to work...am forced to use my Xbox360 with its Ethernet connector to watch Netflix. Really wish Amazon would allow the off-loading of apps from the Play Store that Amazon doesn't have available like Coursera.
author: Furball

review: This was hard to install on my TV. It took two days and multiple online searches for the problems my computer expert son and I encountered with installation. Also the remote is difficult to use. Fast forward rushes ahead at a breakneck speed. It is hard to reach the area of a movie or TV show one wants to view. I will continue to use the Fire TV Stick in hopes that it will be easier to use as I become more familiar with it. The movies and TV productions themselves are of good quality and enjoyable to watch once one finally is able to get to where the user wants to be.
